issue.title: fix build error
issue.body:
This fixes the nightly build errors by adding `picnic3` instead of `picnic2`. 

OIDs have been counted up.

##### Checklist
- [x] documentation is added or updated
- [x] tests are added or updated (automatic)
CCI execution [here](https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/baentsch/openssl/90/workflows/0aaeef2c-e5a7-436c-a1b5-561173858783)

comment.body:
> Can you rebase this off of master, and then undo #221 and #222 so it is no longer pinned to liboqs 0.3.0? Once this passes with liboqs HEAD it should be ready to merge.

So done. Please re-review and approve for merge.

issue.title: Document PQC options in man pages
issue.body: Edit the man page files (.1) to document PQC options.

issue.title: Undefined behaviour in qTesla
issue.body:
When enabling clang's UndefinedBehaviorSanitizer using the build sequence
```
mkdir build && cd build
cmake -DCMAKE_C_COMPILER=clang-9 -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Debug -DUSE_SANITIZER=Undefined -GNinja ..
ninja
```
there are several undefined behaviours identified in the qTesla code.  The log is below:

```
root@8995fd9c66df:~/liboqs/build# tests/test_sig qTesla-p-I   
Configuration info
==================
Target platform:  x86_64-Linux-4.19.76-linuxkit
Compiler:         clang (9.0.0 (tags/RELEASE_900/final))
OQS version:      0.2.1-dev
Git commit:       b3ca583e00ceafc800cf0c1f75d4965bdc627b22
OpenSSL enabled:  Yes (OpenSSL 1.1.1  11 Sep 2018)
AES:              OpenSSL
SHA-2:            OpenSSL
SHA-3:            OpenSSL
CFLAGS:            -fvisibility=hidden -Werror -Wall -Wextra -Wpedantic -Wimplicit -Wunused -Wcomment -Wchar-subscripts -Wuninitialized -Wstrict-prototypes -Wshadow -Wformat-security -Wwrite-strings -ggdb3 -fcolor-diagnostics -Wno-missing-braces

================================================================================
Sample computation for signature qTesla-p-I
================================================================================
../src/sig/qtesla/portable/poly.c:56:9: runtime error: signed integer overflow: 2166416674282987 * 2205847551 cannot be represented in type 'long'
../src/sig/qtesla/portable/pack.c:35:39: runtime error: left shift of 246699749 by 29 places cannot be represented in type 'int32_t' (aka 'int')
../src/sig/qtesla/portable/pack.c:36:54: runtime error: left shift of 206969157 by 26 places cannot be represented in type 'int32_t' (aka 'int')

../src/sig/qtesla/portable/pack.c:39:55: runtime error: left shift of 92158313 by 17 places cannot be represented in type 'int32_t' (aka 'int')
../src/sig/qtesla/portable/pack.c:40:55: runtime error: left shift of 334355572 by 14 places cannot be represented in type 'int32_t' (aka 'int')
../src/sig/qtesla/portable/pack.c:41:55: runtime error: left shift of 262515030 by 11 places cannot be represented in type 'int32_t' (aka 'int')
../src/sig/qtesla/portable/pack.c:42:55: runtime error: left shift of 197729790 by 8 places cannot be represented in type 'int32_t' (aka 'int')

issue.title: Undefined behaviour in SIKE compressed
issue.body:
When enabling clang's UndefinedBehaviorSanitizer using the build sequence
```
mkdir build && cd build
cmake -DCMAKE_C_COMPILER=clang-9 -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Debug -DUSE_SANITIZER=Undefined -GNinja ..
ninja
```
there are several undefined behaviours identified in the SIKE compressed code.  The log is below:

```
root@8995fd9c66df:~/liboqs/build# tests/test_kem SIKE-p434-compressed
Configuration info
==================
Target platform:  x86_64-Linux-4.19.76-linuxkit
Compiler:         clang (9.0.0 (tags/RELEASE_900/final))
OQS version:      0.2.1-dev
Git commit:       b3ca583e00ceafc800cf0c1f75d4965bdc627b22
OpenSSL enabled:  Yes (OpenSSL 1.1.1  11 Sep 2018)
AES:              OpenSSL
SHA-2:            OpenSSL
SHA-3:            OpenSSL
CFLAGS:            -fvisibility=hidden -Werror -Wall -Wextra -Wpedantic -Wimplicit -Wunused -Wcomment -Wchar-subscripts -Wuninitialized -Wstrict-prototypes -Wshadow -Wformat-security -Wwrite-strings -ggdb3 -fcolor-diagnostics -Wno-missing-braces

================================================================================
Sample computation for KEM SIKE-p434-compressed
================================================================================
../src/kem/sike/P434/../compression/dlog.c:108:35: runtime error: index 4 out of bounds for type 'const f2elm_t' (aka 'felm_t const[2]')
../src/kem/sike/P434/../compression/dlog.c:96:39: runtime error: index 330 out of bounds for type 'const f2elm_t' (aka 'felm_t const[2]')
../src/kem/sike/P434/../compression/dlog.c:98:39: runtime error: index 330 out of bounds for type 'const f2elm_t' (aka 'felm_t const[2]')
../src/kem/sike/P434/../compression/dlog.c:115:35: runtime error: index 4 out of bounds for type 'const f2elm_t' (aka 'felm_t const[2]')
../src/kem/sike/P434/../compression/dlog.c:65:34: runtime error: index 4 out of bounds for type 'const f2elm_t' (aka 'felm_t const[2]')
../src/kem/sike/P434/../compression/dlog.c:58:38: runtime error: index 8 out of bounds for type 'const f2elm_t' (aka 'felm_t const[2]')
shared secrets are equal
root@8995fd9c66df:~/liboqs/build# tests/test_kem SIKE-p503-compressed

../src/kem/sike/P503/../compression/dlog.c:96:39: runtime error: index 930 out of bounds for type 'const f2elm_t' (aka 'felm_t const[2]')
